      • create

        public GameItem create​(java.lang.String typeName)
        Create an item of the passed type and insert it into the database
        Parameters:
        typeName - The name of the type for the item to be created (can be a container)
        Returns:
        An appropriate GameItem representing what was added to the database

      • createContainer

        public GameItemContainer createContainer​(java.lang.String typeName)
        Create an container of the passed type and insert it into the database
        Parameters:
        typeName - The name of the type for the item to be created (can be a container)
        Returns:
        An appropriate GameItemContainer representing what was added to the database, or null if the type is not a container type.

      • createContainer

        public GameItemContainer createContainer​(ItemType itemType)

      • create

        public GameItem create​(ItemType itemType)
        Create a new GameItem of type itemType and insert it into the database and the appropriate hashmap. This method can create both GameItemContainers and GameItems.
        Parameters:
        itemType - Individual type to be created
        Returns:
        GameItem representation of the item that was inserted into the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - for any database errors encountered.

      • create

        public GameItem create​(ItemType itemType,
                       java.lang.String originalName,
                       double value)
        Create a new GameItem of type itemType and insert it into the database and the appropriate hashmap. This method can create both GameItemContainers and GameItems.
        Parameters:
        itemType - Individual type to be created
        originalName - Initial name of the item (currently no way to change this)--null to keep unset
        value - Special value of the item (currently no way to change this)--Double.NaN to keep unset
        Returns:
        GameItem representation of the item that was inserted into the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - for any database errors encountered.

      • renameContainer

        public boolean renameContainer​(GameItemContainer container,
                               java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the passed container to the passed name (and updates the database)
        Parameters:
        container - GameItemContainer to be renamed
        name - String containing the new name of the container. It may not contain single quotes.
        Returns:
        true if successful, and false otherwise

      • addItemToContainer

        public boolean addItemToContainer​(GameItem item,
                                  GameItemContainer container)
        Add the passed item to the passed container in both the database and in-memory representations. Note that it is up to the caller to ensure that capacity limits are not being exceeded--no checks are done here.
        Parameters:
        item - GameItem to be added
        container - GameItemContainer we're adding into
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • addItemToContainer

        public boolean addItemToContainer​(int itemID,
                                  int containerID)
        Add the referenced item to the referenced container in both the database and in-memory representations. Note that it is up to the caller to ensure that capacity limits are not being exceeded--no checks are done here.
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of the item to be added
        containerID - ID of the container we're adding into
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • removeItemFromContainer

        public boolean removeItemFromContainer​(GameItem item,
                                       GameItemContainer container)
        Removes the passed item from the passed container in both the database and in-memory representations.
        Parameters:
        item - GameItem to be removed
        container - GameItemContainer we're removing from
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • removeItemFromContainer

        public boolean removeItemFromContainer​(int itemID,
                                       int containerID)
        Removes the referenced item from the referenced container in both the database and in-memory representations.
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of the item to be removed
        containerID - ID of the container we're removing from
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • removeAllFromContainer

        public boolean removeAllFromContainer​(GameItemContainer container)
        Removes all items from the passed container in both the database and in-memory representations.
        Parameters:
        container - GameItemContainer we're removing from
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • removeAllFromContainer

        public boolean removeAllFromContainer​(int containerID)
        Removes all items from the referenced container in both the database and in-memory representations.
        Parameters:
        containerID - ID of the container we're removing from
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • delete

        public boolean delete​(GameItem item)
        Deletes the referenced item from the in-memory representation, marks it as deleted in the database, and removes it from any containers in the database. NOTE: this method does not remove the item from its container in the in-memory representation.
        Parameters:
        item - GameItem to be marked as deleted
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • delete

        public boolean delete​(int itemID)
        Deletes the referenced item from the in-memory representation, marks it as deleted in the database, and removes it from any containers in the database. NOTE: this method does not remove the item from its container in the in-memory representation.
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of the item to be marked as deleted
        Returns:
        true if the operation was successful, and false otherwise.

      • refresh

        public void refresh​(BulletZoneData bzData,
                    ItemTypeRepository itemTypeRepo)
        Reads the database and fills the HashMaps as appropriate. Intended to be called once at time of initialization.
        Parameters:
        bzData - reference to BulletZoneData class to use for SQL queries
        itemTypeRepo - reference to an already-initialized ItemTypeRepository
